name: 趙莊敏
objective: This course is an introductory course of Economics. The major goal is to help students understand the basic principles and theories of Economics, and therefore have a better understanding of how the economy works as a whole, and the potential and limits of economic policies.
schedule:
Week　　Topic
1　　Introduction
2　　Ten Principles of Economics
3　　Thinking like an Economist
4　　Principles of Comparative Advantages
5　　Gains from Trade
6　　Demand
7　　Supply
8　　Equilibrium
9　　Midterm Exam
10　　The Elasticity of Demand
11　　The Elasticity of Supply
12　　Applications of Supply, Demand, and Elasticity
13　　Government Policy: Price Control
14　　Government Policy:Taxes
15　　Consumer Surplus
16　　Producer Surplus
17　　Market Efficiency
18　　Final Exam
scorePolicy:
In-Class Quiz　　　　　　                      10%
Class Participation and Presentations　　　　    10%
Mid-Term Exam  　　　　                                40%
Final Exam                                   　　　　    40%
materials:
”Principles of Economics,” by N. Gregory Mankiw, 4th Edition.
”Naked Economics: Undressing the Dismal Science,” by Wheelan, Charles/ Malkiel, Burton G. (FRW).
